Solution:
find mid and define low and high for each loop while low <= high
both iterative (better bcz of space complexity) or recursive approach
Comment:
Compare with binary tree
Max no of iterations --> height of binary tree --> ceiling [log2n]
log2n time complexity

Problem Statement: Search First/Last Occurrence of element in sorted array
Solution:
same as binary search
just check if left/right element of mid is same element or not
Comment: corner case -> if mid == 0 then code should not check for -1 index and if mid == length of array then should not check for +1 index

Problem Statement: Count of occurrences of a number in sorted array
Solution: first occurrence, last occurrence and difference
Comment: corner case -> if first occurrence is -1 then return -1, don't search for last occurrence

Problem Statement: Count of occurrences of 1 in sorted binary array
Solution: First occurrence of 1 -> length - index of first occurrence of 1
Comment:
corner case -> -1 if 1 is not present, 
only 2 conditions to be checked either value is 1 or 0

Problem Statement: Square root of a number to floor integer value
Solution: from 0 to num/2 use binary search and find number whose sq is closest to num.
Comment: maintain a var result -> update it only if sq of mid < num

Problem Statement: Search in infinite sized sorted array
Solution: Go to index 1, search element, if not found, go to index*2 index and then search and compare values
Comment:
Instead of dividing the array by 2, we raise index by 2 and then apply binary search
Corner Case -> For first index (0), check with condition bcz we need to multiply index by 2 on each iteration. So start with 1
Time Complexity: O(log k) where k is position/index of value

Solution: Go to mid, go the side where element is bigger
Comment:
corner case -> handle first and last index cases as well, 
We only find first peak element using this approach

Solution: Go to mid, go the corner elements and compare the value with num

Problem Statement: Find if there is pair with sum x in sorted array
Key Points to solve:
Sorted Array
Pair with given sum
Solution: Take 2 pointers at 2 ends, increase low or decrease high based on sum value

Problem Statement: Find if there is triplet with sum x in sorted array
Key Points to solve:
Sorted Array
Triplet with given sum
Solution: Go from left to right, find pair with sum (x-currentIndexValue)
Comment:
Run loop from 0 to n-3 and call pair sum for the remaining array.
Pass low and high as param to pair with given sum func

Solution: Find mid for both and do left/right in shorter array based on whether all left side of both arrays is less than mid point of shorter array

Problem Statement: Find the only repeating element from 0 to n-1
